ðŸ’¡ froggit | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To provide developers with a more intuitive and visually organized way to interact with Git directly from their terminal, simplifying common and advanced Git operations.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Modern, minimalist Git TUI â€¢ Visual feedback â€¢ Keyboard-driven controls â€¢ Streamlined Git workflow â€¢ Configuration file for customization (froggit.yml)
ðŸ“– Summary: Froggit is a modern, minimalist Git Text User Interface (TUI) designed to enhance the command-line Git experience. It offers visual feedback, keyboard-driven controls, and streamlined Git operations for clarity and speed within the terminal.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ llm-god | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To provide a unified desktop interface for interacting with multiple LLM services concurrently, enhancing user productivity by reducing context switching and copy-pasting.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Simultaneously prompt multiple LLMs â€¢ Supports ChatGPT, Google Gemini, Anthropic Claude, X.ai Grok, DeepSeek, and Copilot â€¢ Paste text or screenshots directly into the prompt area
ðŸ“– Summary: LLM-God is a desktop application for Windows that allows users to simultaneously prompt multiple large language models (LLMs) like ChatGPT, Gemini, and Claude from a single interface. It aims to streamline workflows by eliminating the need to copy-paste between different LLM web interfaces, saving time for both coding and non-coding tasks.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ budget_tracker_tui | Rust
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Tracking and visualizing personal income and expenses within a terminal environment.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Intuitive Terminal UI â€¢ Transaction Management (Add, View, Edit, Delete) â€¢ Recurring Transactions â€¢ Advanced Filtering â€¢ Hierarchical Categorization
ðŸ“– Summary: Budget Tracker TUI is a Rust-based Terminal User Interface application for managing personal finances. It allows users to track income and expenses, categorize transactions, visualize spending with charts, and monitor budget progress directly within the terminal.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ Blitzkrieg-2 | C++
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Providing access to the source code and assets of the Blitzkrieg 2 video game for community, educational, and research purposes under a non-commercial license.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Open-source game engine source code (non-commercial license) â€¢ Game assets and data included â€¢ Development tools and scripts â€¢ Map editor and documentation â€¢ Multiple language localizations
ðŸ“– Summary: Blitzkrieg 2 is a 2005 real-time tactics video game whose source code was released in 2025 under a non-commercial license. The repository contains the game's engine source code, assets, and development tools, allowing for community, educational, and research use.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ cheatshh | Shell
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To provide users with a quick and organized way to store, access, and recall command-line commands and their associated information, acting as a personal command-line reference.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Interactive CLI for managing command-line cheatsheets â€¢ Store, group, and view commands with descriptions, TLDR, and man pages â€¢ Customizable cheatsheets and groups â€¢ Bookmark commands for easy access
ðŸ“– Summary: Cheatshh is an interactive command-line interface (CLI) tool written in shell script for managing and accessing command-line cheatsheets. It allows users to store, group, and easily retrieve commands with their descriptions, TLDR, and man pages, reducing the need to memorize commands.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ elementBlur | JavaScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To obscure sensitive information or emphasize specific content on webpages for privacy, focus, or presentation purposes.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Dual Mode (blur/highlight) â€¢ Element Selection â€¢ Region Drawing â€¢ Text Selection â€¢ Color Picker
ðŸ“– Summary: Element Blur & Highlight Extension is a browser extension that allows users to selectively blur or highlight elements, text, or custom regions on any webpage. It offers dual modes for blurring and highlighting, with controls for color, opacity, and intensity, along with undo/redo functionality and screenshot capabilities.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source
